page.title: 19PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: Problems and Answers: Railway and bus services have tended to be curtailed because of high costs of fuel, materials, maintenance and personal skills required to run top grade efficient services. As a consequence commuters to other centres of employment have tended to use their own personal transport such as the motor car which of course, though costly, is very convenient. To return to full public transport facilities would require an improved use of existing services and/or a reduction in costs of conveyance neither of which seem likely and an additional hope for subsidisation cannot be envisaged. However there still exists a suitable public transport system, rail and road, which satisfies present demands.
